key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA fares exceeded China Airlines’ website prices on over 93% of itineraries, establishing a consistent premium.
MSE achieved price parity with the airline’s website on 64.8% of itineraries, rising 9.7% week-on-week and 15.0% month-on-month.
GDS fares surpassed website rates on 97.35% of routes, reflecting a stable, high-frequency markup channel.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: OTA fares exceeded website prices on over 93% of itineraries, making higher quotes the norm across the channel.
Average OTA fare premium was just 0.09% last week, virtually unchanged from the prior week and month.
Discounted OTA fares occurred on fewer than 0.5% of itineraries yet delivered an average 0.16% price reduction, doubling prior levels.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: In the latest week, OTAs lacked offers on 6.6% of itineraries, up 1.01 ppt week-over-week and 0.76 ppt month-over-month.
No routes showed identical fares on OTA and the China Airlines website in the latest week.
OTA prices exceeded website fares on 93.07% of routes, a decrease of 1.34 ppt week-over-week and 1.09 ppt month-over-month.
OTA prices were lower on only 0.33% of routes, up from zero, with an average discount of 0.16% last week.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: On short-haul routes, OTA fares were higher on 93.07% of itineraries, missing on 6.6% and lower on 0.33%, mirroring overall shifts.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For Taiwan origins, OTA prices were higher on 96.64% of itineraries with a 0.11% markup, stable week-over-week and up 0.81 ppt month-over-month, with no discounts observed.
For non-Taiwan origins, OTA fares exceeded website prices on 89.61% of itineraries (down 2.65 ppt WoW, 2.91 ppt MoM) with a 0.06% markup and 0.65% of itineraries discounted by 0.16%.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: In the close-in window, OTA prices were higher on 92.61% of itineraries (–0.99 ppt WoW, –0.55 ppt MoM) with a 0.09% premium and 0.49% of itineraries discounted by 0.16%.
In the far-out window, OTA fares led on 94% of itineraries (–2.08 ppt WoW, –2.00 ppt MoM) with a 0.08% premium, no discounts, and 6% of itineraries missing offers.

mse_highlights.line_content: 64.8% of MSE itineraries matched the website last week, up 9.7% versus the prior week and 15.0% versus last month.
MSE listings priced lower than the site slipped to 34.2% share last week, down 10.1% WoW and 14.9% MoM.
Itineraries priced higher on MSE held at just 0.33% share last week, indicating stable, minimal markup activity.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Listings not found on MSE accounted for 0.66% share, doubling week-on-week but down 37% month-on-month, reflecting minor distribution gaps.
Matching fares rose to 64.8% of itineraries, a 9.7% increase from the prior week and 15.0% uptick versus the previous month.
Higher-priced listings remained minimal at 0.33% share, unchanged week-on-week and up 0.33% month-on-month.
Lower-priced itineraries represented 34.2% share, declining 10.1% WoW and 14.9% MoM, signaling shrinking discount prevalence.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul routes mirrored overall trends with 64.8% parity and 34.2% lower-priced listings, both showing similar weekly and monthly shifts.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: TW-origin routes saw 72.7% parity last week (up 15.2% WoW, 27.5% MoM) and only 26.0% discounted listings (down 15.9% WoW, 26.8% MoM).
Non-TW origins posted 57.1% parity (up 3.9% WoW, 2.4% MoM) and 42.2% discounts (down 4.0% WoW, 3.0% MoM).

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in itineraries showed 64.2% parity (up 7.6% WoW, 12.1% MoM) and 34.3% discounts (down 8.1% WoW, 12.0% MoM).
Far-out bookings achieved 65.7% parity (up 13.7% WoW, 20.7% MoM) and 34.3% discounts (down 13.7% WoW, 20.7% MoM).

gds_highlights.line_content: GDS fares exceeded website rates on 97.35% of itineraries last week, maintaining near-identical share WoW and rising modestly MoM.
Only 2.32% of routes feature lower GDS fares, down 0.31 ppt WoW and 0.09 ppt MoM.
Price parity occurs on just 0.33% of routes, while missing offers on GDS dropped to zero last week.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Website-only fares are now absent on GDS (0.00% last week), eliminating the 0.34-point gap from the prior month.
Parity holds on 0.33% of itineraries, marking the first weekly uptick since parity emerged.
GDS fares are higher on 97.35% of routes, a stable trend WoW with a slight MoM rise.
Lower-priced GDS itineraries represent 2.32% of routes, declining both weekly and monthly.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul itineraries mirror overall trends: 97.35% pricier on GDS, 2.32% lower and negligible parity or missing offers.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: From TW, 98.67% of GDS fares exceed website rates (down 0.66 ppt WoW) and just 1.33% are lower (up 0.66 ppt).
Non-TW markets show 95.45% higher GDS fares (stable) and 3.90% lower fares (down 0.62 ppt), reflecting slightly more lower-price instances than TW.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Within close-in windows, 96.55% of GDS fares are higher (flat WoW, –0.82 ppt MoM) and 3.45% are lower (flat WoW, +0.82 ppt MoM).
For far-out bookings, 98.00% of GDS fares exceed website prices (–1.01 ppt WoW) and only 1.00% are lower.
